Python's Popular Packages

By examining every package on PyPi and inspecting every setup.py file I could find, I've made a list of the most referenced and required Python packages there are. Showing what are the most popular and critical packages in use today.

View the Project on GitHub

Most ‘required’ packages in PyPi distributions

  1. setuptools -- referenced by 6638 of packages
  2. requests -- referenced by 6011 of packages
  3. six -- referenced by 2968 of packages
  4. numpy -- referenced by 2774 of packages
  5. Django -- referenced by 1792 of packages
  6. django -- referenced by 1554 of packages
  7. scipy -- referenced by 1166 of packages
  8. lxml -- referenced by 1158 of packages
  9. python-dateutil -- referenced by 955 of packages
  10. click -- referenced by 934 of packages
  11. Flask -- referenced by 911 of packages
  12. PyYAML -- referenced by 904 of packages
  13. zope.interface -- referenced by 902 of packages
  14. matplotlib -- referenced by 900 of packages
  15. pandas -- referenced by 837 of packages
  16. pyyaml -- referenced by 832 of packages
  17. pbr -- referenced by 798 of packages
  18. beautifulsoup4 -- referenced by 773 of packages
  19. docopt -- referenced by 706 of packages
  20. simplejson -- referenced by 690 of packages
  21. argparse -- referenced by 687 of packages
  22. pytz -- referenced by 669 of packages
  23. zope.component -- referenced by 649 of packages
  24. nose -- referenced by 559 of packages
  25. jinja2 -- referenced by 522 of packages
